title: Government EV consultation welcomed as charging networks stress 'vital' need for interoperability leadership
lead: ​The government’s consultation into public electric vehicle (EV) charging has been largely praised by EV charging networks, although thought must be given to costs and complexity.
author: Alice Grundy

title: SMS commits to carbon neutrality by 2030, targeting renewables and EVs
lead: ​Smart meter company SMS will adopt on-site renewable generation and battery storage, as it works towards its 2030 net zero carbon target.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Eelpower selects EDF to optimise 80MW of battery storage
lead: ​Energy storage operator Eelpower has selected EDF as a trading and optimising partner for three of its batteries.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Origami enters Gore Street’s Port of Tilbury into Dynamic Containment pushing capacity over 400MW
lead: ​Optimiser Origami has entered Gore Street Energy Storage Fund’s 9MW Port of Tilbury battery into Dynamic Containment (DC) services.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Heat Pump Federation calls for "consistency of policy" amidst reports of early Green Homes Grant closure
lead: ​The Heat Pump Federation is urging for “consistency of policy” as the impact on installers is highlighted.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Flexibility and the ENA: Farina Farrier takes a look at the Open Networks project
lead: ENA’s head of Open Networks Farina Farrier explores how the association is driving forward change that will improve transparency, boost new flexibility markets, and secure the supply of clean, low-carbon energy.
author: Farina Farrier

title: Centrica commits to fleet electrification by 2025
lead: Centrica has committed to electrifying its 12,000-strong operational fleet by 2025, five years earlier than it had previously aimed for.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Green Finance Institute partners Laudes Foundation to accelerate built environment decarbonisation
lead: ​The Green Finance Institute has announced a new partnership with the Laudes Foundation to accelerate the decarbonisation of the built environment.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Bulb co-founder Gudka steps down to launch new energy storage venture Virmati Energy
lead: ​Bulb co-founder Amit Gudka is stepping down to launch a battery energy storage company, dubbed Virmati Energy.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Current± Chats: Octopus Centre for Net Zero CEO Lucy Yu discusses her plans for the centre
lead: Current± caught up with Yu to chat about the “dream job”, the centre’s initial focuses and the benefits of bringing together a broad range of experts.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Government to reportedly shutter Green Homes Grant after less than a year
lead: ​The Green Homes Grant is to reportedly be scrapped next month following less than a year of operation.
author: Alice Grundy

title: British Gas announced as final Electric Nation energy partner
lead: ​British Gas has become the latest supplier to join Western Power Distribution's (WPD) vehicle-to-grid (V2G) trial, Electric Nation.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ENA unveils ‘ground-breaking’ in-depth digital system map to support decarbonisation pathway
lead: ​Energy Networks Association (ENA) is developing an in-depth digital system map of the UK’s energy system to support a pathway to net zero.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ROUND-UP: Zap-Map and Bulb expand senior leadership teams
lead: Zap-Map announces a new interim CEO and commercial director, while Bulb appoints a new VP Experience.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: LowCVP backs zero emission transport goals with rebrand to Zemo Partnership
lead: LowCVP has rebranded as the Zemo Partnership to reflect the need for UK road transport emissions to fall to zero by 2050.
author: Alice Grundy

title: EDF records 'solid' financial results as renewables generation remains strong
lead: ​EDF has recorded what it has described as "solid" financial results as its renewable generation has soared by 6.3%.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Limejump hails ‘terrific response’ in power market as it adds 170MW already in 2021
lead: ​Limejump has added more than 200 renewable generators to its Virtual Power Plant (VPP) through Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) in 2021.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SSEN secures 384MW of flexibility contracts
lead: ​Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (SSEN) has secured 348MW of flexibility contracts across five sites in Scotland and two in central and southern England.
author: Alice Grundy

title: EV chargers deployed as part of EV100 commitments surge by 79%
lead: ​Nearly 16,900 electric vehicle (EV) chargepoints have been installed for companies signed up to The Climate Group’s EV100 initiative.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Alfen continues strong EV charging growth with 105% increase in 2020 revenues
lead: ​Alfen has posted its FY 2020 results, with its electric vehicle (EV) charging business continuing to see a significant increase as revenues jump 105%.
author: Alice Grundy
